00041 namespace {

00043 class generator_t {
00044     public:
00045     typedef base_random_generator::result_type result_type;
00046     typedef boost::mt19937 default_random_t;
00047 
00048     #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00049         generator_t() { mLock.lock(); init(); }
00050         ~generator_t() { mLock.unlock(); }
00051     #else
00052         generator_t() { init(); }
00053     #endif
00054 
00055     result_type operator()() { return mGeneratorObj->operator()(); }
00056 
00057     static void set_generator(base_random_generator *p) { mGeneratorObj.reset(p); }
00058 
00059     private:
00060     void init() {
00061         if (mGeneratorObj.get() == 0) {
00062             typedef default_random_t T;
00063             T *genobj(new T(boost::uint32_t(time(0)+clock())));
00064             random_generator<T> *obj=new random_generator<T>(genobj);
00065             set_generator(obj);
00066         }
00067     }
00068 
00069     static std::auto_ptr<base_random_generator> mGeneratorObj;
00070 
00071     #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00072         static boost::mutex mLock;
00073     #endif
00074 };
00075 
00076 std::auto_ptr<base_random_generator> generator_t::mGeneratorObj;
00077 
00078 #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00079     boost::mutex generator_t::mLock;
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 } // namespace

00084 namespace detail {

00086 void set_random_generator(base_random_generator *obj) {
00087     generator_t::set_generator(obj);
00088 }

00090 unsigned int get_random() {
00091     generator_t gen;
00092     return gen();
00093 }

00098 // The secure random generator
00099 
00101 #ifdef _WIN32
00102     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00103         typedef BOOLEAN (WINAPI *RtlGenRandomFn)(PVOID, ULONG);
00104         typedef DWORD result_type;
00105 
00106         impl_t(): dll(0), fn(0) {
00107             // This should work under WinXP, Vista, and Win7. No guarantees about
00108             // future compatibility, but I doubt that Microsoft will get rid of it
00109             // (it's too useful), and I doubt that they'll change it now that it's
00110             // well-known (it would break too many programs). We could also use the
00111             // rand_s function in more recent versions of Visual C++, but that
00112             // causes compatibility problems with older versions of Windows.
00113             dll=LoadLibraryA("Advapi32.dll");
00114             if (dll != 0) fn=RtlGenRandomFn(GetProcAddress(dll, "SystemFunction036"));
00115             if (fn == 0) {
00116                 destroy();
00117                 throw no_strong_random();
00118             }
00119         }
00120 
00121         ~impl_t() { destroy(); }
00122 
00123         result_type operator()() {
00124             result_type r=0;
00125             if (!fn(&r, sizeof(result_type)))
00126                 throw no_strong_random("RtlGenRandom failed");
00127             return r;
00128         }
00129 
00130         void destroy() { if (dll) FreeLibrary(dll); }
00131 
00132         HMODULE dll;
00133         RtlGenRandomFn fn;
00134     };
00135 
00136     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 32; }
00137 #else
00138     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00139         typedef unsigned char result_type;
00140 
00141         impl_t(): rng("/dev/urandom", std::ios::binary) {
00142             // This should be supported under most non-Windows systems. Note
00143             // that we're using /dev/urandom, not /dev/random -- /dev/random is
00144             // more secure, but it can be VERY slow.
00145             if (!rng) throw no_strong_random();
00146         }
00147 
00148         result_type operator()() {
00149             int r=rng.get();
00150             if (r==EOF) throw no_strong_random("/dev/urandom returned EOF");
00151             return static_cast<result_type>(r);
00152         }
00153 
00154         std::ifstream rng;
00155     };
00156 
00157     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 8; }
00158 #endif
00160 
00161 const bool strong_random_generator::has_fixed_range = true;
00162 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min_value =
00163     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::min)();
00164 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max_value =
00165     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::max)();
00166 strong_random_generator::strong_random_generator(): impl(new impl_t) { }
00167 strong_random_generator::~strong_random_generator() { delete impl; }
00168 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::operator()() {
00169     return (*impl)(); }

00172 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min
00173     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return min_value; }
00174 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max
00175     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return max_value; }

00179 // Returns a positive (unless told otherwise) integer between zero and
00180 // (1<<bits)-1, inclusive
00181 
00202 integer random_by_size(size_t bits, bool high_bit_on, bool low_bit_on, bool
00203     can_be_negative)
00204 {
00205     if (bits<=0) return integer::zero();
00206 
00207     generator_t randomGenerator;
00208     const size_t cBitsPerIteration=std::numeric_limits<generator_t::result_type>::digits;
00209 
00210     // Grab a set of random bits, of at least the specified size
00211     size_t iterations = (bits+cBitsPerIteration-1) / cBitsPerIteration;
00212     std::vector<generator_t::result_type> v;
00213     for (size_t i=0; i<iterations; ++i) v.push_back(randomGenerator());
00214 
00215     const char *vptr=(const char *)&v[0], *vptr_end=vptr+(v.size() * sizeof(generator_t::result_type));
00216     integer p=from_binary(std::string(vptr, vptr_end));
00217 
00218     // Trim it to the proper length
00219     size_t index=(bits/bits_per_digit);
00220     digit_t mask=(digit_t(1) << (bits % bits_per_digit))-1;
00221     if (mask==0) { mask=digit_mask; --index; }
00222     p._get_data()->digits[index] &= mask;
00223     for (digit_t *i=p._get_data()->digits+index+1,
00224         *ie=p._get_data()->digits+p._get_data()->mLength; i<ie; ++i) *i=0;
00225     p._get_data()->skipLeadingZeros();
00226 
00227     if (high_bit_on) setbit(p, bits-1);
00228     if (low_bit_on) setbit(p, 0);
00229     if (can_be_negative) p._set_negative(randomGenerator() & 0x01);
00230 
00231     return p;
00232 }
